title: BOC user wants to update a UR Waiver Request before sending Waiver Request Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a club or BOC user
AND user has navigated to the Waiver Request Entry widget
custom_steps:
WHEN the user submits a UR Waiver request
BUT user does not send the Request Bulletin
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to edit the following fields:
   Wishes to play in a foreign league checkbox (and corresponding Country dropdown)
   Cash Consideration Amount
   Comments
BUT user should NOT be able to edit Type and "As per release [date] [time]"

title: BOC user wants to update a UR Waiver Request after sending Waiver Request Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged 
AND a UR Waiver request has already been submitted 
AND the Request Bulletin corresponding to this UR Waiver Request has already been sent
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Request Entry Screen
custom_expected:
THEN none of the following fields should be editable:
   Wishes to play in a foreign league checkbox (and corresponding Country dropdown)
   Cash Consideration Amount
   Comments
   Type and "As per release [date] [time]"

title: BOC user wants to edit the day's requests - Specific Org is selected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the Waivers screen on Transactions dashboard
AND edit button is displayed on the form 
AND a specific Org is selected from the dropdown
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks the Edit button
custom_expected:
THEN form should be reloaded in edit mode
AND save button should become available
AND no fields in the "Players with Requested Waivers" table should be editable
BUT Claim Period Expires field and "Request Bulletin Comments" textfield should be editable
AND  "Request Entry" section of the form should also be expandable and editable
AND "Add Player" button should be available
AND if no request has been entered for that Org for that day clicking "Edit", then there should be a blank Request Entry in the "Request Entry" section of the form
AND "Latest Transaction" field should always be shown to BOC and should be editable (within the Request Entry section)
AND The available fields and styling should follow the data discovery and the wireframe

title: BOC user wants to edit the day's requests - "All" is selected from Org dropdown
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the Waivers screen on Transactions dashboard
AND edit button is displayed on the form 
AND a "All" is selected from the Org dropdown
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks the Edit button
custom_expected:
THEN form should be reloaded in edit mode
AND save button should become available
AND no fields in the "Players with Requested Waivers" table should be editable
BUT Claim Period Expires field and "Request Bulletin Comments" textfield should be editable
AND "Add Player" button should not be visible or should be disabled 
AND The available fields and styling should follow the data discovery and the wireframe

title: BOC user wants to save edits to the day's requests
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the Waivers screen on the transactions dashboard
AND user is viewing the day's requests on the widget in Edit mode
AND Save button is available on the form 
BUT "Submit" button is NOT available
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Save"
custom_expected:
THEN the system should run a required field and formatting check, as well as all "On Submit" rules for any newly entered players
AND if a new request has been entered for an Org which did not previously have a submitted request, then the "Submitted By" and "Submitted On" fields for that request should be populated
BUT if that Org had at least one prior request for this bulletin then the Submitted information should not be updated
AND once all required fields and rules have passed, the form should reload in View mode, with "Request Entry" section collapsed and "Players with Requested Waivers" section expanded

title: User wants to receive error if "Player has recovered" checkbox has not been checked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request for a player
AND "Player has recovered" checkbox is not checked
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate a blocker message (error message #31)
AND BOC should be able to override the error

title: User wants to receive warning if there are any players with Irrevocable Waivers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is attempting to Submit a Waiver Request for a player
AND Waiver Request has Irrevocable Waivers
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate blocker error 	
“You have requested Irrevocable Waivers on the following players:
 
List of players with Irrevocable Waivers (Last, First)
AND clicking "Back" should close the modal and return user to the request
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should ignore the error and continue with the request

title: User wants to receive error if UR waivers are selected and Release Date is later than current Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is attempting to Submit a Waiver Request for a player
AND user has selected UR waivers
AND Release Date is later than current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate blocker error “Invalid Date entered for [Last Name], [First Name]’s Release, cannot be after the Current Date.”
AND clicking "Back" should close the modal and return user to the form

title: User wants to receive error if it is after 2:00 PM ET on Request Date when request is submitted
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to Submit a Waiver Request for a player
AND current time is after 2:00 PM ET on the Date of the Request
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate blocker message “Invalid Waiver Request for [Last Name], [First Name]. New requests may not be submitted after 2:00 PM on the request date.”
AND clicking "Back" should close the modal and return user to the request
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should ignore the error and continue with the request (BOC only)

title: Release from Roster tx automatically created for Unconditional Release Waiver Requests
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request for a player
AND the request is a UR Waiver Request
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the UR Waiver Request
custom_expected:
THEN user should be alerted with message "The Release from Roster transaction for <Lastname, Firstname> has been changed to Approved state successfully"
AND Effective Date should be set from the "As Per Release on" date
AND Player's player history should be updated with: Code = URREL Description = Release from Roster, From Org/Club To Org/Club fields to be in black font, To Org/Club fields blank
AND automatically created "As per Release...." comment from waiver request should be saved in the tx
AND player's MJ Roster status should be set to "Released from Roster"
AND system should ensure that a 2nd transaction is not created if set of requests are submitted a 2nd time with UR included

title: User wants to receive error if UR waivers are selected and player's pending MJ status is Deceased, Disqualified, Ineligible, Military Leave, Restricted, or Suspended
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to Submit a Waiver Request for a player
AND user selects UR Waivers
AND selected player's pending or actual MJ roster status is Deceased, Disqualified, Ineligible, Military Leave, Restricted, or Suspended
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate blocker message “Ineligible Waiver Request. [Last Name], [First Name] is on the [Inactive List Type] list and must be reinstated before waivers may be requested.”
AND clicking "Back" should close the modal and return user to the request
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should ignore the error and continue with the request (BOC only)

title: User wants to see weekend waiver periods on system dates screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a club or BOC user
AND user has permissions to edit System Dates screen
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to System Dates Screen
custom_expected:
THEN "Allow Weekend Waiver Requests" should be an available field
AND user should be able to enter or pick a start date and end date

title: User wants to cancel any edits to Request Entry
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a club or BOC user
AND user has navigated to the Waiver Request Entry screen
AND and user is attempting to edit a Waiver Request
AND "Cancel" button is available on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Cancel" while editing the request
custom_expected:
THEN system should display message  "Are you sure you want to Cancel? You will lose any unsaved changes."
AND "Yes" and "No" options should be available 
AND clicking 'Yes' should remove any changes since the last "submit" and reload the form in view mode, maintaining the selected org and date
AND clicking 'No' should close the modal and allow the user to continue working.

title: User wants errors to be handled on request entry using standard/global format
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC or club user
AND user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request Entry 
AND required fields are missing from the form
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks "Submit"
custom_expected:
THEN global error modal should be displayed
AND when user clicks "Back" to close the error modal, errors should be pinned to the browser and the missed required fields should be highlighted in red

title: User wants to see Claim Expiration and Withdrawal Expiration dates on Request Entry screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as club or BOC user
AND has navigated to the Waivers tab on the Transactions dashboard
custom_steps:
WHEN the user opens the waivers screen
AND user selects a Request Date
custom_expected:
THEN Claim Period Expires [Date] - [Time] and Withdrawal Period Expires [Date] - [Time] should also be displayed
AND "Claim Period Expires" should be 2 waiver business days after the request date
AND "Withdrawal Period Expires" should be 2 waiver business days after the claiming period expiration date

title: User wants to see comments if selected player is a 10/5 player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as club or BOC user
AND user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request Entry
custom_steps: WHEN user selects a 10/5 player (greater than 10 years total MLS with at least the last 5 years at the same club - found in Service section of the Player Profile)
custom_expected: THEN the text "10/5 Player" should be appended to the Comments

title: BOC user wants to send a Request Bulletin
BOC user wants to view submitted Waiver Requests
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request and generate Request Bulletin
custom_steps: WHEN  BOC user first navigates to the waivers screen, the Request Date should default to the oldest pending (unsent) Request Bulletin
custom_expected:
AND 'All' should be a choice in the Org dropdown and is the default selection 
AND selecting a single "Org" should refresh the page to display only the selected Org's players within the Players with Requested Waivers section
AND The only sections visible should be "Request Entry" and "Players with Requested Waivers"
AND "Request Entry" should be collapsed by default
AND "Players with Requested Waivers" should be expanded, and display all submitted requests, sorted alphabetically by Org and then Player Last Name, First Name
AND Player names in the Players with Requested Waivers table should be hyperlinks to the player's Player History
AND Displayed fields and layout should match the wireframe and data discovery

title: BOC user wants to expand Requests Entry while in Players with Requested Waivers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to Players with Requested Waivers section of Waivers tab on transactions dashboard
AND form is in view or edit mode
AND user has selected "All" in the Org dropdown
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to expand the "Request Entry" section
custom_expected:
THEN system should display blocking message "An Org must be selected to see Requests"
AND clicking back should return the user to the screen with Request Entry still collapsed

title: BOC user wants to navigate to the Request Entry for a single Org from Players with submitted Waiver Requests section
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user 
AND user has navigated to Waiver Request Screen on Transactions Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user views the  "Players with Requested Waivers" section of the form,
custom_expected:
THEN the "Org" column should display as a hyperlink
AND if Org filter is set to "All"then clicking on the "Org" column with a request listed should switch the filter from "All" to the selected Org, expand "Request Entry" portion of the screen and place the focus of the screen at the top of the "Request Entry" portion 
AND user should not be prompted to confirm that they know they will lose changes, if in edit mode
AND if Org filter is set to a specific org then clicking "Org" column hyperlink should take the user to the top of the "Request Entry" section with it expanded

title: BOC user wants to see "Send Request Bulletin" button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC user
AND user is attempting to send a Waiver Request Bulletin
custom_steps:
WHEN Current Date is ≥ Request date
AND current time is after 2PM EST on the Request Date
custom_expected:
THEN "Send Request Bulletin" button should be visible for BOC users in view and edit mode
BUT "Send Request Bulletin" button should only be enabled in view mode
